title: The Old Road
description: [Characters] sit inside the stagecoach, travelling down the old road towards the Hamlet for the first time, about to start their long quest. The party should still be in the stagecoach, surrounded by the old grizzled trees of the old road, the Hamlet still not in sight. This is the prologue, and the characters aren't yet fully aware of the horrors that await them.

title: Crash
description: Travelling down the old road, the stagecoach crashes, abruptly ending the journey. The Caretaker, who was driving, and the horses disappear. [Characters] assess their injuries and begin making their way to the Hamlet by foot. This is the prologue, and the characters aren't yet fully aware of the horrors that await them.

title: Send these vermin a message
description: The party has trudged down the old road for some distance when [Enemies] emerge from the shadows ahead. Fatigued but alert, [Characters] prepare for their first real fight. Set the stage for the battle, but don't start it yet.
keywords: Send these vermin a message. The rightful owners has returned, and their kind is no longer welcome!

title: Vanquished
description: After defeating [Enemies] encountered on the old road, [Characters] pause to assess the situation. Narrate their post-battle conversation—whether relieved, hostile, or weary—and their actions as they continue their journey towards the Hamlet on foot.

title: The way is shut
description: Approaching the Hamlet's outskirts, [Characters] discover a ravaged tent. As they loot and investigate, [Enemies] emerge from the shadows, blocking the path forward. The final obstacle before sanctuary reveals itself. Set the stage for the battle, but don't start it yet.
keywords: Courage in the face of danger

title: The Hamlet
description: After the grueling trek down the old road on foot, battered and weary, [Characters] finally stumble into the Hamlet. The Caretaker stands waiting at the edge of town, impossibly present despite his disappearance. His incoherent explanations only deepen the unsettling strangeness. The tangle of narrow streets and leaning buildings sprawls before them - their quest truly begins here.

title: The Announcement
description: In the town square, the Town Crier's bell summons what remains of the Hamlet's population. Beneath the Ancestor's weathered statue, [Character 1] and [Character 2] step forward and, despite not yet having seen their enemies, appoint themselves Margrave and Bursar of this afflicted borderland against corruption, which will stand fast against the horrors the Ancestor brought forth. The stone gaze above bears silent witness as they vow to drive back the darkness and reclaim what was lost. [Character 3] and [Character 4] watch from the side. This is the prologue, and the characters aren't yet fully aware of the horrors that await them.
keywords: Narrator acknowledges himself at the end
